 33 /*global JXG:true, define: true*/
 34 /*jslint nomen: true, plusplus: true*/
 35 
 36 /* depends:
 37  jxg
 38  base/constants
 39  base/coords
 40  math/statistics
 41  utils/type
 42  base/element
 43   elements:
 44    segment
 45    transform
 46  */
 47 
 48 define([
 49     'jxg', 'base/constants', 'base/coords', 'math/statistics', 'math/geometry', 'utils/type', 'base/element', 'base/line', 'base/transformation'
 50 ], function (JXG, Const, Coords, Statistics, Geometry, Type, GeometryElement, Line, Transform) {
 51 
 52     "use strict";
 53 
 54     /**
 55      * Creates a new instance of JXG.Polygon.
 56      * @class Polygon stores all style and functional properties that are required
 57      * to draw and to interactact with a polygon.
 58      * @param {JXG.Board} board Reference to the board the polygon is to be drawn on.
 59      * @param {Array} vertices Unique identifiers for the points defining the polygon.
 60      * Last point must be first point. Otherwise, the first point will be added at the list.
 61      * @param {Object} attributes An object which contains properties as given in {@link JXG.Options.elements}
 62      * and {@link JXG.Options.polygon}.
 63      * @constructor
 64      * @extends JXG.GeometryElement
 65      */
 66 
 67     JXG.Polygon = function (board, vertices, attributes) {
 68         this.constructor(board, attributes, Const.OBJECT_TYPE_POLYGON, Const.OBJECT_CLASS_AREA);
 69 
 70         var i, l, len, j,
 71             attr_line = Type.copyAttributes(attributes, board.options, 'polygon', 'borders');
 72 
 73         this.withLines = attributes.withlines;
 74         this.attr_line = attr_line;
 75 
 76         /**
 77          * References to the points defining the polygon. The last vertex is the same as the first vertex.
 78          * @type Array
 79          */
 80         this.vertices = [];
 81         for (i = 0; i < vertices.length; i++) {
 82             this.vertices[i] = this.board.select(vertices[i]);
 83         }
 84 
 85         // Close the polygon
 86         if (this.vertices.length > 0 && this.vertices[this.vertices.length - 1].id !== this.vertices[0].id) {
 87             this.vertices.push(this.vertices[0]);
 88         }
 89 
 90         /**
 91          * References to the border lines of the polygon.
 92          * @type Array
 93          */
 94         this.borders = [];
 95 
 96         if (this.withLines) {
 97             len = this.vertices.length - 1;
 98             for (j = 0; j < len; j++) {
 99                 // This sets the "correct" labels for the first triangle of a construction.
100                 i = (j + 1) % len;
101                 attr_line.id = attr_line.ids && attr_line.ids[i];
102                 attr_line.name = attr_line.names && attr_line.names[i];
103                 attr_line.strokecolor = (Type.isArray(attr_line.colors) && attr_line.colors[i % attr_line.colors.length]) ||
104                                             attr_line.strokecolor;
105                 attr_line.visible = Type.exists(attributes.borders.visible) ? attributes.borders.visible : attributes.visible;
106 
107                 if (attr_line.strokecolor === false) {
108                     attr_line.strokecolor = 'none';
109                 }
110 
111                 l = board.create('segment', [this.vertices[i], this.vertices[i + 1]], attr_line);
112                 l.dump = false;
113                 this.borders[i] = l;
114                 l.parentPolygon = this;
115             }
116         }
117         this.inherits.push(this.vertices, this.borders);
118 
119         // Register polygon at board
120         // This needs to be done BEFORE the points get this polygon added in their descendants list
121         this.id = this.board.setId(this, 'Py');
122 
123         // Add polygon as child to defining points
124         for (i = 0; i < this.vertices.length - 1; i++) {
125             this.board.select(this.vertices[i]).addChild(this);
126         }
127 
128         this.board.renderer.drawPolygon(this);
129         this.board.finalizeAdding(this);
130 
131         this.createGradient();
132         this.elType = 'polygon';
133 
134         // create label
135         this.createLabel();
136 
137         this.methodMap = JXG.deepCopy(this.methodMap, {
138             borders: 'borders',
139             vertices: 'vertices',
140             A: 'Area',
141             Area: 'Area',
142             Perimeter: 'Perimeter',
143             L: 'Perimeter',
144             Length: 'Perimeter',
145             boundingBox: 'boundingBox',
146             bounds: 'bounds',
147             addPoints: 'addPoints',
148             insertPoints: 'insertPoints',
149             removePoints: 'removePoints'
150         });
151     };
152 
153     JXG.Polygon.prototype = new GeometryElement();
154 
155     JXG.extend(JXG.Polygon.prototype, /** @lends JXG.Polygon.prototype */ {
156         /**
157          * Checks whether (x,y) is near the polygon.
158          * @param {Number} x Coordinate in x direction, screen coordinates.
159          * @param {Number} y Coordinate in y direction, screen coordinates.
160          * @returns {Boolean} Returns true, if (x,y) is inside or at the boundary the polygon, otherwise false.
161          */
162         hasPoint: function (x, y) {
163 
164             var i, j, len, c = false;
165 
166             if (Type.evaluate(this.visProp.hasinnerpoints)) {
167                 // All points of the polygon trigger hasPoint: inner and boundary points
168                 len = this.vertices.length;
169                 // See http://www.ecse.rpi.edu/Homepages/wrf/Research/Short_Notes/pnpoly.html
170                 // for a reference of Jordan method
171                 for (i = 0, j = len - 2; i < len - 1; j = i++) {
172                     if (((this.vertices[i].coords.scrCoords[2] > y) !== (this.vertices[j].coords.scrCoords[2] > y)) &&
173                             (x < (this.vertices[j].coords.scrCoords[1] - this.vertices[i].coords.scrCoords[1]) * (y - this.vertices[i].coords.scrCoords[2]) /
174                             (this.vertices[j].coords.scrCoords[2] - this.vertices[i].coords.scrCoords[2]) + this.vertices[i].coords.scrCoords[1])) {
175                         c = !c;
176                     }
177                 }
178                 if (c) {
179                     return true;
180                 }
181             }
182 
183             // Only boundary points trigger hasPoint
184             // We additionally test the boundary also in case hasInnerPoints.
185             // Since even if the above test has failed, the strokewidth may be large and (x, y) may
186             // be inside of hasPoint() of a vertices.
187             len = this.borders.length;
188             for (i = 0; i < len; i++) {
189                 if (this.borders[i].hasPoint(x, y)) {
190                     c = true;
191                     break;
192                 }
193             }
194 
195             return c;
196         },
197 
198         /**
199          * Uses the boards renderer to update the polygon.
200          */
201         updateRenderer: function () {
202             var i, len; // wasReal,
203 
204 
205             if (!this.needsUpdate) {
206                 return this;
207             }
208 
209             if (this.visPropCalc.visible) {
210                 // wasReal = this.isReal;
211 
212                 len = this.vertices.length;
213                 this.isReal = true;
214                 for (i = 0; i < len; ++i) {
215                     if (!this.vertices[i].isReal) {
216                         this.isReal = false;
217                         break;
218                     }
219                 }
220 
221                 if (//wasReal &&
222                     !this.isReal) {
223                     this.updateVisibility(false);
224                 }
225             }
226 
227             if (this.visPropCalc.visible) {
228                 this.board.renderer.updatePolygon(this);
229             }
230 
231             /* Update the label if visible. */
232             if (this.hasLabel && this.visPropCalc.visible && this.label &&
233                 this.label.visPropCalc.visible && this.isReal) {
234 
235                 this.label.update();
236                 this.board.renderer.updateText(this.label);
237             }
238 
239             // Update rendNode display
240             this.setDisplayRendNode();
241             // if (this.visPropCalc.visible !== this.visPropOld.visible) {
242             //     this.board.renderer.display(this, this.visPropCalc.visible);
243             //     this.visPropOld.visible = this.visPropCalc.visible;
244             //
245             //     if (this.hasLabel) {
246             //         this.board.renderer.display(this.label, this.label.visPropCalc.visible);
247             //     }
248             // }
249 
250             this.needsUpdate = false;
251             return this;
252         },
253 
254         /**
255          * return TextAnchor
256          */
257         getTextAnchor: function () {
258             var a, b, x, y, i;
259 
260             if (this.vertices.length === 0) {
261                 return new Coords(Const.COORDS_BY_USER, [1, 0, 0], this.board);
262             }
263 
264             a = this.vertices[0].X();
265             b = this.vertices[0].Y();
266             x = a;
267             y = b;
268             for (i = 0; i < this.vertices.length; i++) {
269                 if (this.vertices[i].X() < a) {
270                     a = this.vertices[i].X();
271                 }
272 
273                 if (this.vertices[i].X() > x) {
274                     x = this.vertices[i].X();
275                 }
276 
277                 if (this.vertices[i].Y() > b) {
278                     b = this.vertices[i].Y();
279                 }
280 
281                 if (this.vertices[i].Y() < y) {
282                     y = this.vertices[i].Y();
283                 }
284             }
285 
286             return new Coords(Const.COORDS_BY_USER, [(a + x) * 0.5, (b + y) * 0.5], this.board);
287         },
288 
289         getLabelAnchor: JXG.shortcut(JXG.Polygon.prototype, 'getTextAnchor'),
290 
291         // documented in geometry element
292         cloneToBackground: function () {
293             var copy = {}, er;
294 
295             copy.id = this.id + 'T' + this.numTraces;
296             this.numTraces++;
297             copy.vertices = this.vertices;
298             copy.visProp = Type.deepCopy(this.visProp, this.visProp.traceattributes, true);
299             copy.visProp.layer = this.board.options.layer.trace;
300             copy.board = this.board;
301             Type.clearVisPropOld(copy);
302 
303             copy.visPropCalc = {
304                 visible: Type.evaluate(copy.visProp.visible)
305             };
306 
307             er = this.board.renderer.enhancedRendering;
308             this.board.renderer.enhancedRendering = true;
309             this.board.renderer.drawPolygon(copy);
310             this.board.renderer.enhancedRendering = er;
311             this.traces[copy.id] = copy.rendNode;
312 
313             return this;
314         },
315 
316         /**
317          * Hide the polygon including its border lines. It will still exist but not visible on the board.
318          * @param {Boolean} [borderless=false] If set to true, the polygon is treated as a polygon without
319          * borders, i.e. the borders will not be hidden.
320          */
321         hideElement: function (borderless) {
322             var i;
323 
324             JXG.deprecated('Element.hideElement()', 'Element.setDisplayRendNode()');
325 
326             this.visPropCalc.visible = false;
327             this.board.renderer.display(this, false);
328 
329             if (!borderless) {
330                 for (i = 0; i < this.borders.length; i++) {
331                     this.borders[i].hideElement();
332                 }
333             }
334 
335             if (this.hasLabel && Type.exists(this.label)) {
336                 this.label.hiddenByParent = true;
337                 if (this.label.visPropCalc.visible) {
338                     this.label.hideElement();
339                 }
340             }
341         },
342 
343         /**
344          * Make the element visible.
345          * @param {Boolean} [borderless=false] If set to true, the polygon is treated as a polygon without
346          * borders, i.e. the borders will not be shown.
347          */
348         showElement: function (borderless) {
349             var i;
350 
351             JXG.deprecated('Element.showElement()', 'Element.setDisplayRendNode()');
352 
353             this.visPropCalc.visible = true;
354             this.board.renderer.display(this, true);
355 
356             if (!borderless) {
357                 for (i = 0; i < this.borders.length; i++) {
358                     this.borders[i].showElement().updateRenderer();
359                 }
360             }
361 
362             if (Type.exists(this.label) && this.hasLabel && this.label.hiddenByParent) {
363                 this.label.hiddenByParent = false;
364                 if (!this.label.visPropCalc.visible) {
365                     this.label.showElement().updateRenderer();
366                 }
367             }
368             return this;
369         },
370 
371         /**
372          * Area of (not self-intersecting) polygon
373          * @returns {Number} Area of (not self-intersecting) polygon
374          */
375         Area: function () {
376             return Math.abs(Geometry.signedPolygon(this.vertices, true));
377         },
378 
379         /**
380          * Perimeter of polygon.
381          * @returns {Number} Perimeter of polygon in user units.
382          *
383          * @example
384          * var p = [[0.0, 2.0], [2.0, 1.0], [4.0, 6.0], [1.0, 3.0]];
385          *
386          * var pol = board.create('polygon', p, {hasInnerPoints: true});
387          * var t = board.create('text', [5, 5, function() { return pol.Perimeter(); }]);
388          * </pre><div class="jxgbox" id="b10b734d-89fc-4b9d-b4a7-e3f0c1c6bf77" style="width: 400px; height: 400px;"></div>
389          * <script type="text/javascript">
390          *  (function () {
391          *   var board = JXG.JSXGraph.initBoard('b10b734d-89fc-4b9d-b4a7-e3f0c1c6bf77', {boundingbox: [-1, 9, 9, -1], axis: false, showcopyright: false, shownavigation: false}),
392          *       p = [[0.0, 2.0], [2.0, 1.0], [4.0, 6.0], [1.0, 4.0]],
393          *       cc1 = board.create('polygon', p, {hasInnerPoints: true}),
394          *       t = board.create('text', [5, 5, function() { return cc1.Perimeter(); }]);
395          *  })();
396          * </script><pre>
397          *
398          */
399         Perimeter: function() {
400             var i,
401                 len = this.vertices.length,
402                 val = 0.0;
403 
404             for (i = 1; i < len; ++i) {
405                 val += this.vertices[i].Dist(this.vertices[i - 1]);
406             }
407 
408             return val;
409         },
410 
411         /**
412          * Bounding box of a polygon. The bounding box is an array of four numbers: the first two numbers
413          * determine the upper left corner, the last two number determine the lower right corner of the bounding box.
414          *
415          * The width and height of a polygon can then determined like this:
416          * @example
417          * var box = polygon.boundingBox();
418          * var width = box[2] - box[0];
419          * var height = box[1] - box[3];
420          *
421          * @returns {Array} Array containing four numbers: [minX, maxY, maxX, minY]
422          */
423         boundingBox: function () {
424             var box = [0, 0, 0, 0], i, v,
425                 le = this.vertices.length - 1;
426 
427             if (le === 0) {
428                 return box;
429             }
430             box[0] = this.vertices[0].X();
431             box[2] = box[0];
432             box[1] = this.vertices[0].Y();
433             box[3] = box[1];
434 
435             for (i = 1; i < le; ++i) {
436                 v = this.vertices[i].X();
437                 if (v < box[0]) {
438                     box[0] = v;
439                 } else if (v > box[2]) {
440                     box[2] = v;
441                 }
442 
443                 v = this.vertices[i].Y();
444                 if (v > box[1]) {
445                     box[1] = v;
446                 } else if (v < box[3]) {
447                     box[3] = v;
448                 }
449             }
450 
451             return box;
452         },
453 
454         // already documented in GeometryElement
455         bounds: function () {
456             return this.boundingBox();
457         },
458 
459         /**
460          * This method removes the SVG or VML nodes of the lines and the filled area from the renderer, to remove
461          * the object completely you should use {@link JXG.Board#removeObject}.
462          */
463         remove: function () {
464             var i;
465 
466             for (i = 0; i < this.borders.length; i++) {
467                 this.board.removeObject(this.borders[i]);
468             }
469 
470             GeometryElement.prototype.remove.call(this);
471         },
472 
473         /**
474          * Finds the index to a given point reference.
475          * @param {JXG.Point} p Reference to an element of type {@link JXG.Point}
476          */
477         findPoint: function (p) {
478             var i;
479 
480             if (!Type.isPoint(p)) {
481                 return -1;
482             }
483 
484             for (i = 0; i < this.vertices.length; i++) {
485                 if (this.vertices[i].id === p.id) {
486                     return i;
487                 }
488             }
489 
490             return -1;
491         },
492 
493         /**
494          * Add more points to the polygon. The new points will be inserted at the end.
495          * @param {JXG.Point} p Arbitrary number of points
496          * @returns {JXG.Polygon} Reference to the polygon
497          */
498         addPoints: function (p) {
499             var args = Array.prototype.slice.call(arguments);
500 
501             return this.insertPoints.apply(this, [this.vertices.length - 2].concat(args));
502         },
503 
504         /**
505          * Adds more points to the vertex list of the polygon, starting with index <tt><i</tt>
506          * @param {Number} idx The position where the new vertices are inserted, starting with 0.
507          * @param {JXG.Point} p Arbitrary number of points to insert.
508          * @returns {JXG.Polygon} Reference to the polygon object
509          */
510         insertPoints: function (idx, p) {
511             var i, npoints = [], tmp;
512 
513             if (arguments.length === 0) {
514                 return this;
515             }
516 
517 
518             if (idx < 0 || idx > this.vertices.length - 2) {
519                 return this;
520             }
521 
522             for (i = 1; i < arguments.length; i++) {
523                 if (Type.isPoint(arguments[i])) {
524                     npoints.push(arguments[i]);
525                 }
526             }
527 
528             tmp = this.vertices.slice(0, idx + 1).concat(npoints);
529             this.vertices = tmp.concat(this.vertices.slice(idx + 1));
530 
531             if (this.withLines) {
532                 tmp = this.borders.slice(0, idx);
533                 this.board.removeObject(this.borders[idx]);
534 
535                 for (i = 0; i < npoints.length; i++) {
536                     tmp.push(this.board.create('segment', [this.vertices[idx + i], this.vertices[idx + i + 1]], this.attr_line));
537                 }
538 
539                 tmp.push(this.board.create('segment', [this.vertices[idx + npoints.length], this.vertices[idx + npoints.length + 1]], this.attr_line));
540                 this.borders = tmp.concat(this.borders.slice(idx + 1));
541             }
542 
543             this.board.update();
544 
545             return this;
546         },
547 
548         /**
549          * Removes given set of vertices from the polygon
550          * @param {JXG.Point} p Arbitrary number of vertices as {@link JXG.Point} elements or index numbers
551          * @returns {JXG.Polygon} Reference to the polygon
552          */
553         removePoints: function (p) {
554             var i, j, idx, nvertices = [], nborders = [],
555                 nidx = [], partition = [];
556 
557             // partition:
558             // in order to keep the borders which could be recycled, we have to partition
559             // the set of removed points. I.e. if the points 1, 2, 5, 6, 7, 10 are removed,
560             // the partitions are
561             //       1-2, 5-7, 10-10
562             // this gives us the borders, that can be removed and the borders we have to create.
563 
564 
565             // remove the last vertex which is identical to the first
566             this.vertices = this.vertices.slice(0, this.vertices.length - 1);
567 
568             // collect all valid parameters as indices in nidx
569             for (i = 0; i < arguments.length; i++) {
570                 idx = arguments[i];
571                 if (Type.isPoint(idx)) {
572                     idx = this.findPoint(idx);
573                 }
574 
575                 if (Type.isNumber(idx) && idx > -1 && idx < this.vertices.length && Type.indexOf(nidx, idx) === -1) {
576                     nidx.push(idx);
577                 }
578             }
579 
580             // remove the polygon from each removed point's children
581             for (i = 0; i < nidx.length; i++) {
582                 this.vertices[nidx[i]].removeChild(this);
583             }
584 
585             // sort the elements to be eliminated
586             nidx = nidx.sort();
587             nvertices = this.vertices.slice();
588             nborders = this.borders.slice();
589 
590             // initialize the partition
591             if (this.withLines) {
592                 partition.push([nidx[nidx.length - 1]]);
593             }
594 
595             // run through all existing vertices and copy all remaining ones to nvertices
596             // compute the partition
597             for (i = nidx.length - 1; i > -1; i--) {
598                 nvertices[nidx[i]] = -1;
599 
600                 if (this.withLines && (nidx[i] - 1 > nidx[i - 1])) {
601                     partition[partition.length - 1][1] = nidx[i];
602                     partition.push([nidx[i - 1]]);
603                 }
604             }
605 
606             // finalize the partition computation
607             if (this.withLines) {
608                 partition[partition.length - 1][1] = nidx[0];
609             }
610 
611             // update vertices
612             this.vertices = [];
613             for (i = 0; i < nvertices.length; i++) {
614                 if (Type.isPoint(nvertices[i])) {
615                     this.vertices.push(nvertices[i]);
616                 }
617             }
618             if (this.vertices[this.vertices.length - 1].id !== this.vertices[0].id) {
619                 this.vertices.push(this.vertices[0]);
620             }
621 
622             // delete obsolete and create missing borders
623             if (this.withLines) {
624                 for (i = 0; i < partition.length; i++) {
625                     for (j = partition[i][1] - 1; j < partition[i][0] + 1; j++) {
626                         // special cases
627                         if (j < 0) {
628                             // first vertex is removed, so the last border has to be removed, too
629                             j = 0;
630                             this.board.removeObject(this.borders[nborders.length - 1]);
631                             nborders[nborders.length - 1] = -1;
632                         } else if (j > nborders.length - 1) {
633                             j = nborders.length - 1;
634                         }
635 
636                         this.board.removeObject(this.borders[j]);
637                         nborders[j] = -1;
638                     }
639 
640                     // only create the new segment if it's not the closing border. the closing border is getting a special treatment at the end
641                     // the if clause is newer than the min/max calls inside createSegment; i'm sure this makes the min/max calls obsolete, but
642                     // just to be sure...
643                     if (partition[i][1] !== 0 && partition[i][0] !== nvertices.length - 1) {
644                         nborders[partition[i][0] - 1] = this.board.create('segment', [nvertices[Math.max(partition[i][1] - 1, 0)], nvertices[Math.min(partition[i][0] + 1, this.vertices.length - 1)]], this.attr_line);
645                     }
646                 }
647 
648                 this.borders = [];
649                 for (i = 0; i < nborders.length; i++) {
650                     if (nborders[i] !== -1) {
651                         this.borders.push(nborders[i]);
652                     }
653                 }
654 
655                 // if the first and/or the last vertex is removed, the closing border is created at the end.
656                 if (partition[0][1] === this.vertices.length - 1 || partition[partition.length - 1][1] === 0) {
657                     this.borders.push(this.board.create('segment', [this.vertices[0], this.vertices[this.vertices.length - 2]], this.attr_line));
658                 }
659             }
660 
661             this.board.update();
662 
663             return this;
664         },
665 
666         // documented in element.js
667         getParents: function () {
668             this.setParents(this.vertices);
669             return this.parents;
670         },
671 
672         getAttributes: function () {
673             var attr = GeometryElement.prototype.getAttributes.call(this), i;
674 
675             if (this.withLines) {
676                 attr.lines = attr.lines || {};
677                 attr.lines.ids = [];
678                 attr.lines.colors = [];
679 
680                 for (i = 0; i < this.borders.length; i++) {
681                     attr.lines.ids.push(this.borders[i].id);
682                     attr.lines.colors.push(this.borders[i].visProp.strokecolor);
683                 }
684             }
685 
686             return attr;
687         },
688 
689         snapToGrid: function () {
690             var i, force;
691 
692             if (Type.evaluate(this.visProp.snaptogrid)) {
693                 force = true;
694             } else {
695                 force = false;
696             }
697 
698             for (i = 0; i < this.vertices.length; i++) {
699                 this.vertices[i].handleSnapToGrid(force, true);
700             }
701 
702         },
703 
704         /**
705          * Moves the polygon by the difference of two coordinates.
706          * @param {Number} method The type of coordinates used here. Possible values are {@link JXG.COORDS_BY_USER} and {@link JXG.COORDS_BY_SCREEN}.
707          * @param {Array} coords coordinates in screen/user units
708          * @param {Array} oldcoords previous coordinates in screen/user units
709          * @returns {JXG.Polygon} this element
710          */
711         setPositionDirectly: function (method, coords, oldcoords) {
712             var dc, t, i, len,
713                 c = new Coords(method, coords, this.board),
714                 oldc = new Coords(method, oldcoords, this.board);
715 
716             len = this.vertices.length - 1;
717             for (i = 0; i < len; i++) {
718                 if (!this.vertices[i].draggable()) {
719                     return this;
720                 }
721             }
722 
723             dc = Statistics.subtract(c.usrCoords, oldc.usrCoords);
724             t = this.board.create('transform', dc.slice(1), {type: 'translate'});
725             t.applyOnce(this.vertices.slice(0, -1));
726 
727             return this;
728         },
729 
730         /**
731         * Algorithm by Sutherland and Hodgman to compute the intersection of two convex polygons.
732         * The polygon itself is the clipping polygon, it expects as parameter a polygon to be clipped.
733         * See <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sutherland%E2%80%93Hodgman_algorithm">wikipedia entry</a>.
734         * Called by {@link JXG.Polygon#intersect}.
735         *
736         * @private
737         *
738         * @param {JXG.Polygon} polygon Polygon which will be clipped.
739         *
740         * @returns {Array} of (normalized homogeneous user) coordinates (i.e. [z, x, y], where z==1 in most cases,
741         *   representing the vertices of the intersection polygon.
742         *
743         */
744         sutherlandHodgman: function(polygon) {
745             // First the two polygons are sorted counter clockwise
746             var clip = JXG.Math.Geometry.sortVertices(this.vertices),   // "this" is the clipping polygon
747                 subject = JXG.Math.Geometry.sortVertices(polygon.vertices), // "polygon" is the subject polygon
748 
749                 lenClip = clip.length - 1,
750                 lenSubject = subject.length - 1,
751                 lenIn,
752 
753                 outputList = [],
754                 inputList, i, j, S, E, cross,
755 
756 
757                 // Determines if the point c3 is right of the line through c1 and c2.
758                 // Since the polygons are sorted counter clockwise, "right of" and therefore >= is needed here
759                 isInside = function(c1, c2, c3) {
760                     return ((c2[1] - c1[1]) * (c3[2] - c1[2]) - (c2[2] - c1[2]) * (c3[1] - c1[1])) >= 0;
761                 };
762 
763             for (i = 0; i < lenSubject; i++) {
764                 outputList.push(subject[i]);
765             }
766 
767             for (i = 0; i < lenClip; i++) {
768                 inputList = outputList.slice(0);
769                 lenIn = inputList.length;
770                 outputList = [];
771 
772                 S = inputList[lenIn - 1];
773 
774                 for (j = 0; j < lenIn; j++) {
775                     E = inputList[j];
776                     if (isInside(clip[i], clip[i + 1], E)) {
777                         if (!isInside(clip[i], clip[i + 1], S)) {
778                             cross = JXG.Math.Geometry.meetSegmentSegment(S, E, clip[i], clip[i + 1]);
779                             cross[0][1] /= cross[0][0];
780                             cross[0][2] /= cross[0][0];
781                             cross[0][0] = 1;
782                             outputList.push(cross[0]);
783                         }
784                         outputList.push(E);
785                     } else if (isInside(clip[i], clip[i + 1], S)) {
786                         cross = JXG.Math.Geometry.meetSegmentSegment(S, E, clip[i], clip[i + 1]);
787                         cross[0][1] /= cross[0][0];
788                         cross[0][2] /= cross[0][0];
789                         cross[0][0] = 1;
790                         outputList.push(cross[0]);
791                     }
792                     S = E;
793                 }
794             }
795 
796             return outputList;
797         },
798 
799         /**
800          * Generic method for the intersection of this polygon with another polygon.
801          * The parent object is the clipping polygon, it expects as parameter a polygon to be clipped.
802          * Both polygons have to be convex.
803          * Calls {@link JXG.Polygon#sutherlandHodgman}.
804          *
805          * @param {JXG.Polygon} polygon Polygon which will be clipped.
806          *
807          * @returns {Array} of (normalized homogeneous user) coordinates (i.e. [z, x, y], where z==1 in most cases,
808          *   representing the vertices of the intersection polygon.
809          *
810          * @example
811          *  // Static intersection of two polygons pol1 and pol2
812          *  var pol1 = board.create('polygon', [[-2, 3], [-4, -3], [2, 0], [4, 4]], {
813          *                name:'pol1', withLabel: true,
814          *                fillColor: 'yellow'
815          *             });
816          *  var pol2 = board.create('polygon', [[-2, -3], [-4, 1], [0, 4], [5, 1]], {
817          *                name:'pol2', withLabel: true
818          *             });
819          *
820          *  // Static version:
821          *  // the intersection polygon does not adapt to changes of pol1 or pol2.
822          *  var pol3 = board.create('polygon', pol1.intersect(pol2), {fillColor: 'blue'});
823          * </pre><div class="jxgbox" id="d1fe5ea9-309f-494a-af07-ee3d033acb7c" style="width: 300px; height: 300px;"></div>
824          * <script type="text/javascript">
825          *   (function() {
826          *       var board = JXG.JSXGraph.initBoard('d1fe5ea9-309f-494a-af07-ee3d033acb7c', {boundingbox: [-8, 8, 8,-8], axis: true, showcopyright: false, shownavigation: false});
827          *       // Intersect two polygons pol1 and pol2
828          *       var pol1 = board.create('polygon', [[-2, 3], [-4, -3], [2, 0], [4, 4]], {
829          *                name:'pol1', withLabel: true,
830          *                fillColor: 'yellow'
831          *             });
832          *       var pol2 = board.create('polygon', [[-2, -3], [-4, 1], [0, 4], [5, 1]], {
833          *                name:'pol2', withLabel: true
834          *             });
835          *
836          *       // Static version: the intersection polygon does not adapt to changes of pol1 or pol2.
837          *       var pol3 = board.create('polygon', pol1.intersect(pol2), {fillColor: 'blue'});
838          *   })();
839          * </script><pre>
840          *
841          * @example
842          *  // Dynamic intersection of two polygons pol1 and pol2
843          *  var pol1 = board.create('polygon', [[-2, 3], [-4, -3], [2, 0], [4, 4]], {
844          *                name:'pol1', withLabel: true,
845          *                fillColor: 'yellow'
846          *             });
847          *  var pol2 = board.create('polygon', [[-2, -3], [-4, 1], [0, 4], [5, 1]], {
848          *                name:'pol2', withLabel: true
849          *             });
850          *
851          *  // Dynamic version:
852          *  // the intersection polygon does  adapt to changes of pol1 or pol2.
853          *  // For this a curve element is used.
854          *  var curve = board.create('curve', [[],[]], {fillColor: 'blue', fillOpacity: 0.4});
855          *  curve.updateDataArray = function() {
856          *      var mat = JXG.Math.transpose(pol1.intersect(pol2));
857          *
858          *      if (mat.length == 3) {
859          *          this.dataX = mat[1];
860          *          this.dataY = mat[2];
861          *      } else {
862          *          this.dataX = [];
863          *          this.dataY = [];
864          *      }
865          *  };
866          *  board.update();
867          * </pre><div class="jxgbox" id="f870d516-ca1a-4140-8fe3-5d64fb42e5f2" style="width: 300px; height: 300px;"></div>
868          * <script type="text/javascript">
869          *   (function() {
870          *       var board = JXG.JSXGraph.initBoard('f870d516-ca1a-4140-8fe3-5d64fb42e5f2', {boundingbox: [-8, 8, 8,-8], axis: true, showcopyright: false, shownavigation: false});
871          *       // Intersect two polygons pol1 and pol2
872          *       var pol1 = board.create('polygon', [[-2, 3], [-4, -3], [2, 0], [4, 4]], {
873          *                name:'pol1', withLabel: true,
874          *                fillColor: 'yellow'
875          *             });
876          *       var pol2 = board.create('polygon', [[-2, -3], [-4, 1], [0, 4], [5, 1]], {
877          *                name:'pol2', withLabel: true
878          *             });
879          *
880          *  // Dynamic version:
881          *  // the intersection polygon does  adapt to changes of pol1 or pol2.
882          *  // For this a curve element is used.
883          *    var curve = board.create('curve', [[],[]], {fillColor: 'blue', fillOpacity: 0.4});
884          *    curve.updateDataArray = function() {
885          *        var mat = JXG.Math.transpose(pol1.intersect(pol2));
886          *
887          *        if (mat.length == 3) {
888          *            this.dataX = mat[1];
889          *            this.dataY = mat[2];
890          *        } else {
891          *            this.dataX = [];
892          *            this.dataY = [];
893          *        }
894          *    };
895          *    board.update();
896          *   })();
897          * </script><pre>
898          *
899          */
900         intersect: function(polygon) {
901             return this.sutherlandHodgman(polygon);
902         }
903 
904 
905     });
906 
907 
908     /**
909      * @class A polygon is an area enclosed by a set of border lines which are determined by
910      * <ul>
911      *    <li> a list of points or
912      *    <li> a list of coordinate arrays or
913      *    <li> a function returning a list of coordinate arrays.
914      * </ul>
915      * Each two consecutive points of the list define a line.
916      * @pseudo
917      * @constructor
918      * @name Polygon
919      * @type Polygon
920      * @augments JXG.Polygon
921      * @throws {Exception} If the element cannot be constructed with the given parent objects an exception is thrown.
922      * @param {Array} vertices The polygon's vertices. If the first and the last vertex don't match the first one will be
923      * added to the array by the creator.
924      *
925      * Additionally, a polygon can be created by providing a polygon and a transformation (or an array of transformations).
926      * The result is a polygon which is the transformation of the supplied polygon.
927      *
928      * @example
929      * var p1 = board.create('point', [0.0, 2.0]);
930      * var p2 = board.create('point', [2.0, 1.0]);
931      * var p3 = board.create('point', [4.0, 6.0]);
932      * var p4 = board.create('point', [1.0, 4.0]);
933      *
934      * var pol = board.create('polygon', [p1, p2, p3, p4]);
935      * </pre><div class="jxgbox" id="682069e9-9e2c-4f63-9b73-e26f8a2b2bb1" style="width: 400px; height: 400px;"></div>
936      * <script type="text/javascript">
937      *  (function () {
938      *   var board = JXG.JSXGraph.initBoard('682069e9-9e2c-4f63-9b73-e26f8a2b2bb1', {boundingbox: [-1, 9, 9, -1], axis: false, showcopyright: false, shownavigation: false}),
939      *       p1 = board.create('point', [0.0, 2.0]),
940      *       p2 = board.create('point', [2.0, 1.0]),
941      *       p3 = board.create('point', [4.0, 6.0]),
942      *       p4 = board.create('point', [1.0, 4.0]),
943      *       cc1 = board.create('polygon', [p1, p2, p3, p4]);
944      *  })();
945      * </script><pre>
946      *
947      * @example
948      * var p = [[0.0, 2.0], [2.0, 1.0], [4.0, 6.0], [1.0, 3.0]];
949      *
950      * var pol = board.create('polygon', p, {hasInnerPoints: true});
951      * </pre><div class="jxgbox" id="9f9a5946-112a-4768-99ca-f30792bcdefb" style="width: 400px; height: 400px;"></div>
952      * <script type="text/javascript">
953      *  (function () {
954      *   var board = JXG.JSXGraph.initBoard('9f9a5946-112a-4768-99ca-f30792bcdefb', {boundingbox: [-1, 9, 9, -1], axis: false, showcopyright: false, shownavigation: false}),
955      *       p = [[0.0, 2.0], [2.0, 1.0], [4.0, 6.0], [1.0, 4.0]],
956      *       cc1 = board.create('polygon', p, {hasInnerPoints: true});
957      *  })();
958      * </script><pre>
959      *
960      * @example
961      *   var f1 = function() { return [0.0, 2.0]; },
962      *       f2 = function() { return [2.0, 1.0]; },
963      *       f3 = function() { return [4.0, 6.0]; },
964      *       f4 = function() { return [1.0, 4.0]; },
965      *       cc1 = board.create('polygon', [f1, f2, f3, f4]);
966      *
967      * </pre><div class="jxgbox" id="ceb09915-b783-44db-adff-7877ae3534c8" style="width: 400px; height: 400px;"></div>
968      * <script type="text/javascript">
969      *  (function () {
970      *   var board = JXG.JSXGraph.initBoard('ceb09915-b783-44db-adff-7877ae3534c8', {boundingbox: [-1, 9, 9, -1], axis: false, showcopyright: false, shownavigation: false}),
971      *       f1 = function() { return [0.0, 2.0]; },
972      *       f2 = function() { return [2.0, 1.0]; },
973      *       f3 = function() { return [4.0, 6.0]; },
974      *       f4 = function() { return [1.0, 4.0]; },
975      *       cc1 = board.create('polygon', [f1, f2, f3, f4]);
976      *  })();
977      * </script><pre>
978      *
979      * @example
980      * var t = board.create('transform', [2, 1.5], {type: 'scale'});
981      * var a = board.create('point', [-3,-2], {name: 'a'});
982      * var b = board.create('point', [-1,-4], {name: 'b'});
983      * var c = board.create('point', [-2,-0.5], {name: 'c'});
984      * var pol1 = board.create('polygon', [a,b,c], {vertices: {withLabel: false}});
985      * var pol2 = board.create('polygon', [pol1, t], {vertices: {withLabel: true}});
986      *
987      * </pre><div id="6530a69c-6339-11e8-9fb9-901b0e1b8723" class="jxgbox" style="width: 300px; height: 300px;"></div>
988      * <script type="text/javascript">
989      *     (function() {
990      *         var board = JXG.JSXGraph.initBoard('6530a69c-6339-11e8-9fb9-901b0e1b8723',
991      *             {boundingbox: [-8, 8, 8,-8], axis: true, showcopyright: false, shownavigation: false});
992      *     var t = board.create('transform', [2, 1.5], {type: 'scale'});
993      *     var a = board.create('point', [-3,-2], {name: 'a'});
994      *     var b = board.create('point', [-1,-4], {name: 'b'});
995      *     var c = board.create('point', [-2,-0.5], {name: 'c'});
996      *     var pol1 = board.create('polygon', [a,b,c], {vertices: {withLabel: false}});
997      *     var pol2 = board.create('polygon', [pol1, t], {vertices: {withLabel: true}});
998      *
999      *     })();
1000      *
1001      * </script><pre>
1002      *
1003      */
1004     JXG.createPolygon = function (board, parents, attributes) {
1005         var el, i, le, obj,
1006             points = [],
1007             attr, attr_points,
1008             is_transform = false;
1009 
1010         attr = Type.copyAttributes(attributes, board.options, 'polygon');
1011         obj = board.select(parents[0]);
1012         if (Type.isObject(obj) && obj.type === Const.OBJECT_TYPE_POLYGON &&
1013             Type.isTransformationOrArray(parents[1])) {
1014 
1015             is_transform = true;
1016             le = obj.vertices.length - 1;
1017             attr_points = Type.copyAttributes(attributes, board.options, 'polygon', 'vertices');
1018             for (i = 0; i < le; i++) {
1019                 if (attr_points.withlabel) {
1020                     attr_points.name = (obj.vertices[i].name === '') ? '' : (obj.vertices[i].name + "'");
1021                 }
1022                 points.push(board.create('point', [obj.vertices[i], parents[1]], attr_points));
1023             }
1024         } else {
1025             points = Type.providePoints(board, parents, attributes, 'polygon', ['vertices']);
1026             if (points === false) {
1027                 throw new Error("JSXGraph: Can't create polygon with parent types other than 'point' and 'coordinate arrays' or a function returning an array of coordinates. Alternatively, a polygon and a transformation can be supplied");
1028             }
1029         }
1030 
1031         attr = Type.copyAttributes(attributes, board.options, 'polygon');
1032         el = new JXG.Polygon(board, points, attr);
1033         el.isDraggable = true;
1034 
1035         // Put the points to their position
1036         if (is_transform) {
1037             le = obj.vertices.length - 1;
1038             for (i = 0; i < le; i++) {
1039                 points[i].prepareUpdate().update().updateVisibility(Type.evaluate(el.visProp.visible)).updateRenderer();
1040             }
1041         }
1042 
1043         return el;
1044     };
1045 
1046     /**
1047      * @class Constructs a regular polygon. It needs two points which define the base line and the number of vertices.
1048      * @pseudo
1049      * @description Constructs a regular polygon. It needs two points which define the base line and the number of vertices, or a set of points.
1050      * @constructor
1051      * @name RegularPolygon
1052      * @type Polygon
1053      * @augments Polygon
1054      * @throws {Exception} If the element cannot be constructed with the given parent objects an exception is thrown.
1055      * @param {JXG.Point_JXG.Point_Number} p1,p2,n The constructed regular polygon has n vertices and the base line defined by p1 and p2.
1056      * @example
1057      * var p1 = board.create('point', [0.0, 2.0]);
1058      * var p2 = board.create('point', [2.0, 1.0]);
1059      *
1060      * var pol = board.create('regularpolygon', [p1, p2, 5]);
1061      * </pre><div class="jxgbox" id="682069e9-9e2c-4f63-9b73-e26f8a2b2bb1" style="width: 400px; height: 400px;"></div>
1062      * <script type="text/javascript">
1063      *  (function () {
1064      *   var board = JXG.JSXGraph.initBoard('682069e9-9e2c-4f63-9b73-e26f8a2b2bb1', {boundingbox: [-1, 9, 9, -1], axis: false, showcopyright: false, shownavigation: false}),
1065      *       p1 = board.create('point', [0.0, 2.0]),
1066      *       p2 = board.create('point', [2.0, 1.0]),
1067      *       cc1 = board.create('regularpolygon', [p1, p2, 5]);
1068      *  })();
1069      * </script><pre>
1070      * @example
1071      * var p1 = board.create('point', [0.0, 2.0]);
1072      * var p2 = board.create('point', [4.0,4.0]);
1073      * var p3 = board.create('point', [2.0,0.0]);
1074      *
1075      * var pol = board.create('regularpolygon', [p1, p2, p3]);
1076      * </pre><div class="jxgbox" id="096a78b3-bd50-4bac-b958-3be5e7df17ed" style="width: 400px; height: 400px;"></div>
1077      * <script type="text/javascript">
1078      * (function () {
1079      *   var board = JXG.JSXGraph.initBoard('096a78b3-bd50-4bac-b958-3be5e7df17ed', {boundingbox: [-1, 9, 9, -1], axis: false, showcopyright: false, shownavigation: false}),
1080      *       p1 = board.create('point', [0.0, 2.0]),
1081      *       p2 = board.create('point', [4.0, 4.0]),
1082      *       p3 = board.create('point', [2.0,0.0]),
1083      *       cc1 = board.create('regularpolygon', [p1, p2, p3]);
1084      * })();
1085      * </script><pre>
1086      *
1087      * @example
1088      *         // Line of reflection
1089      *         var li = board.create('line', [1,1,1], {strokeColor: '#aaaaaa'});
1090      *         var reflect = board.create('transform', [li], {type: 'reflect'});
1091      *         var pol1 = board.create('polygon', [[-3,-2], [-1,-4], [-2,-0.5]]);
1092      *         var pol2 = board.create('polygon', [pol1, reflect]);
1093      *
1094      * </pre><div id="58fc3078-d8d1-11e7-93b3-901b0e1b8723" class="jxgbox" style="width: 300px; height: 300px;"></div>
1095      * <script type="text/javascript">
1096      *     (function() {
1097      *         var board = JXG.JSXGraph.initBoard('58fc3078-d8d1-11e7-93b3-901b0e1b8723',
1098      *             {boundingbox: [-8, 8, 8,-8], axis: true, showcopyright: false, shownavigation: false});
1099      *             var li = board.create('line', [1,1,1], {strokeColor: '#aaaaaa'});
1100      *             var reflect = board.create('transform', [li], {type: 'reflect'});
1101      *             var pol1 = board.create('polygon', [[-3,-2], [-1,-4], [-2,-0.5]]);
1102      *             var pol2 = board.create('polygon', [pol1, reflect]);
1103      *
1104      *     })();
1105      *
1106      * </script><pre>
1107      *
1108      */
1109     JXG.createRegularPolygon = function (board, parents, attributes) {
1110         var el, i, n,
1111             p = [], rot, len, pointsExist, attr;
1112 
1113         len = parents.length;
1114         n = parents[len - 1];
1115 
1116         if (Type.isNumber(n) && (parents.length !== 3 || n < 3)) {
1117             throw new Error("JSXGraph: A regular polygon needs two point types and a number > 2 as input.");
1118         }
1119 
1120         if (Type.isNumber(board.select(n))) { // Regular polygon given by 2 points and a number
1121             len--;
1122             pointsExist = false;
1123         } else {                              // Regular polygon given by n points
1124             n = len;
1125             pointsExist = true;
1126         }
1127 
1128         p = Type.providePoints(board, parents.slice(0, len), attributes, 'regularpolygon', ['vertices']);
1129         if (p === false) {
1130             throw new Error("JSXGraph: Can't create regular polygon with parent types other than 'point' and 'coordinate arrays' or a function returning an array of coordinates");
1131         }
1132 
1133         attr = Type.copyAttributes(attributes, board.options, 'regularpolygon', 'vertices');
1134         for (i = 2; i < n; i++) {
1135             rot = board.create('transform', [Math.PI * (2 - (n - 2) / n), p[i - 1]], {type: 'rotate'});
1136             if (pointsExist) {
1137                 p[i].addTransform(p[i - 2], rot);
1138                 p[i].fullUpdate();
1139             } else {
1140                 if (Type.isArray(attr.ids) && attr.ids.length >= n - 2) {
1141                     attr.id = attr.ids[i - 2];
1142                 }
1143                 p[i] = board.create('point', [p[i - 2], rot], attr);
1144                 p[i].type = Const.OBJECT_TYPE_CAS;
1145 
1146                 // The next two lines of code are needed to make regular polgonmes draggable
1147                 // The new helper points are set to be draggable.
1148                 p[i].isDraggable = true;
1149                 p[i].visProp.fixed = false;
1150             }
1151         }
1152 
1153         attr = Type.copyAttributes(attributes, board.options, 'regularpolygon');
1154         el = board.create('polygon', p, attr);
1155         el.elType = 'regularpolygon';
1156 
1157         return el;
1158     };
1159 
1160     JXG.registerElement('polygon', JXG.createPolygon);
1161     JXG.registerElement('regularpolygon', JXG.createRegularPolygon);
1162 
1163     return {
1164         Polygon: JXG.Polygon,
1165         createPolygon: JXG.createPolygon,
1166         createRegularPolygon: JXG.createRegularPolygon
1167     };
1168 });
1169
